|blank1_info = 1021364{{GR|3}} |website = [http://masonboro-north-carolina.santopia.com/ Masonboro page] |footnotes = }} '''Masonboro''' is a [[census-designated place]] (CDP) in [[New Hanover County, North Carolina|New Hanover County]], [[North Carolina]], [[United States]]. The population was 11,812 at the 2000 census. Masonboro is located southeast of [[Wilmington, North Carolina|Wilmington]] near the Atlantic coast. It is part of the Wilmington [[Wilmington metropolitan area|Metropolitan Statistical Area]]. ==Geography== Masonboro is located at {{coord|34.169953|-77.871134|type:city_region:US|format=dms|display=inline}}.{{GR|1}} According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of {{convert|6.6|sqmi|km2}}. 6.0 square miles (15.5 km<sup>2</sup>) of it is land and {{convert|0.6|sqmi|km2}} (9.65%) is water. ==Demographics== At the 2000 [[census]]{{GR|2}}, there were 11,812 people, 4,253 households and 3,474 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 1,970.5 per square mile (761.4/km<sup>2</sup>). There were 4,452 housing units at an average density of 742.7 per square mile (287.0/km<sup>2</sup>). The racial makeup of the CDP was 93.62% [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 3.35% [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 0.28% [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 1.32% [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 0.02% [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 0.32% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 1.09% from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 1.17% of the population. There were 4,253 households of which 42.3% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 73.0% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 6.9% had a female householder with no husband present, and 18.3% were non-families. 14.3% of all households were made up of individuals and 4.6% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.78 and the average family size was 3.08. 28.8% of the population were under the age of 18, 5.0% from 18 to 24, 30.3% from 25 to 44, 26.7% from 45 to 64, and 9.2% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 38 years. For every 100 females there were 96.0 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 92.8 males. The [[median household income]] was $65,110 and the median family income was $68,005. Males had a median income of $51,707 compared with $34,740 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $27,519. About 2.9% of families and 4.3% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 5.8% of those under age 18 and 2.5% of those age 65 or over. ==References== <references /> {{New Hanover County, North Carolina}} [[Category:Populated places in New Hanover County, North Carolina]] [[Category:Census-designated places in North Carolina]] [[Category:Wilmington, North Carolina metropolitan area]]
